==========================
         2 items
==========================

(1) To my amazement, with a help from a friend, I managed to compile 
cantera in C++ .NET 2003!! I even compiled the "C++ Demos" project 
called "CanteraDemos.sln." So far, everything seem to have worked.

(2)How do you properly compile flamespeed.cpp? I created a win32 
console project in .NET. When I tried to build I think it stops at 
line 14 of the flamespeed.cpp code. I installed the Cantera.msi in 
C:\Cantera  .  The source code is in C:\cygwin...etc\directory. 
Error message is attached:

------ Build started: Project: flamespeed, Configuration: Debug 
Win32 ------

Compiling...
stdafx.cpp
Compiling...
flamespeed.cpp
c:\CANTERA\demos\C++\flamespeed\flamespeed.cpp(14) : fatal error 
C1019: unexpected #else

Build log was saved 
at "file://c:\Cantera\demos\C++\flamespeed\Debug\BuildLog.htm"
flamespeed - 1 error(s), 0 warning(s)
